channel.title: Digg Top Stories
channel.description: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

item.title: Google's Stunning Street Views From The Top Of The World
item.description: Your day job, not to mention fitness level, will probably keep you from ever ascending the mightiest peaks on Earth. Don’t worry. Google’s done the hard work for you.

item.title: Porn Hurts Like Hell
item.description: The performers may look like they're in ecstasy, but the physical pain and endurance that goes into sex for the camera would make an NFL linebacker weep.

item.title: I Am The Blogger Who Allegedly 'Complicated' The Steubenville Gang Rape Case – And I Wouldn't Change A Thing
item.description: I stayed up all night screen-grabbing tweets that joked about raping and urinating on a woman they thought might be dead. Welcome to Steubenville.

item.title: Meet The Tiny Phone Maker That Thinks It Can Beat Samsung
item.description: It costs every company about the same to manufacture a phone. So what if you stripped out all of Samsung's unnecessary overhead? One man thinks you'd get a much better phone at a much better price.

item.title: Looking Back At Baghdad, Days After Saddam Fell
item.description: I spent a month in Baghdad, wandering the streets with a toy camera, photographing a visibly traumatized population as it emerged from decades of terror under a sociopathic tyrant—into the chaos of “freedom.”

item.title: Morbid Find Suggests Adam Lanza Plotted Massacre For Years
item.description: Law enforcement reportedly discovers a sickeningly thorough 7-foot-long, 4-foot-wide spreadsheet with names, body counts and weapons from previous mass murders and even attempted killings.

item.title: Who Cleans Up After A Car Crash?
item.description: You might be one of those poor saps who rubbernecks at car wrecks on the side of the road. You've likely wondered how the whole crash site gets cleaned up, even all the little debris?

item.title: Diversity In Silicon Valley Is Apparently A 'Trade Secret'
item.description: How diverse is Silicon Valley? Most tech companies really, really don't want you to know, and the U.S. government isn't helping shed any light on the issue.

item.title: How A Rooster Knows To Crow At Dawn
item.description: The animals know when it's daybreak even in a darkened room, study says.

item.title: Yes, You Can Tell From His Face What Your Dog Is Feeling
item.description: People can correctly identify a wide range of dog emotions by sight.

item.title: When Is A Spirit Too Old To Drink?
item.description: You've seen 50-year-old whiskeys that cost more than your monthly rent, but is it worth it? And can a spirit actually get too old to drink?

item.title: Curiosity Rover Hits New Snag
item.description: A new glitch on NASA's Mars rover Curiosity has forced the vehicle to stay in safe mode longer than planned, stalling science operations for another couple of days, scientists said today.

item.title: Steampunk Before Steampunk Existed
item.description: Charles Dellschau, a Prussian immigrant who came to the U.S. in 1853, was a butcher who lived in Houston. He spent the years between the turn of the century and his death in 1923 working on these scrapbooks, which combined news clippings, text, and art in visions of fantastic flying machines.

item.title: Stuff Exploding At 2,000 Frames Per Second
item.description: Here are some super slow motion highlights from a popular Danish TV show actually called "Stupid and Dangerous"

item.title: A New Google Service Briefly Appeared Online Before Vanishing
item.description: Note-taking app Google Keep briefly went live earlier today before disappearing, but not before someone spotted it and took screenshots.

item.title: How To Survive A Busted Cruise Ship
item.description: You may have heard about a few cruise ship disasters recently. If you remain determined to vacation on the high seas, here's what you need to know to survive the worst.

item.title: The Republican Party Wants To Become An App
item.description: A new platform in at least one sense of the word. The right's new data obsession.

item.title: Want To Solve World Hunger? Eat Insects
item.description: There are forty tons of insects for every single human on this planet. This is a serious idea.

item.title: 3D Printed Gun Maker Now Actually Licensed To Manufacture Guns
item.description: On Saturday, Defense Distributed—America’s best-known group of 3D gunsmiths—announced on Facebook that its founder, Cody Wilson, now has a federal license to be a gun manufacturer and dealer.

item.title: Fixing The Worst Law In Technology
item.description: Something must be done about the law Aaron Swartz was aggressively prosecuted under, the Computer Fraud and Abuse Act.

item.title: From Student To Spy And Back Again
A Guide To Web Security For Newbies
item.description: Most examinations of security and privacy online are written by geeks, and largely only readable by nerds. The problem with that approach, of course, is that most of us are neither.

item.title: Here Are The Airline Extras You Should And Shouldn't Pay For
item.description: Increasingly airlines are offering passengers add-on products and services. Here's Gulliver's authoritative guide to what, and not, to spend your pennies on.

item.title: 20 Haunting Ghost Towns Of The World
item.description: he following ghost towns are a glimpse not only of our recent past, but perhaps also our future.

item.title: The Wild Streets Of New York In The 60s and 70s
item.description: Capturing weirdness on the streets of New York City might seem like an easy feat, but this photographer has a rare ability to capture a confluence of gestures in the exact moment in which a great photograph happens.

item.title: The Secrets Of A Sports Illustrated Body Paint Model
item.description: The gorgeous Alyssa Miller explains the strange techniques for applying a paint-on swimsuit.

item.title: Peek Inside The House That Woz Built
item.description: The difference between building the software behind an entire operating system and the design for a California mountainside mansion? Um, massive. Unless, that is, you happen to be Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak.

item.title: A History Of Helicopter-Aided Jailbreaks
item.description: Two Quebec inmates made headlines around the world Sunday with their dramatic jailbreak after they were whisked from the prison grounds by a helicopter. As daring as the plan was, it’s hardly unique in the history of prison escapes.

item.title: I Tried To Make The Intelligence Behind The Iraq War Less Bogus
item.description: "What we don’t do routinely is tie one catastrophe to another. But that was exactly what I was asked to do in November 2002, shortly after Congress voted to authorize war with Iraq."

item.title: The Best External USB Battery Pack
item.description: If you’re looking for a high-capacity external battery pack that’ll charge your USB-powered gadgets on the go, pick up the Satechi Portable Energy Station 10000.
